file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 26-15-01-06 - CARGO SMOKE DETECTOR - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CARGO SMOKE DETECTOR - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: WALTER KIDDE SMOKE DETECTORS 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to inspect the cargo smoke detectors. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH CARGO SMOKE DETECTION - VISUAL IN- CLASS-D BAGGAGE 26-15-01-200-801-A SPECTION COMPARTMENT AIRCRAFT WITH CARGO SMOKE DETECTION - VISUAL IN- CLASS-C BAGGAGE 26-15-01-200-802-A SPECTION COMPARTMENT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 26-15-01 Page 1 of 7 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-15-01-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-D BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT 2. CARGO SMOKE DETECTION - VISUAL INSPECTION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to check the maintenance LED of the cargo smoke detectors. (2) This task is applicable to two cargo smoke detectors. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 223LZ Cockpit 270 Baggage Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Press the test switch Cockpit 1 Inspect the maintenance LED Baggage Compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-B (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Energize the aircraft with a DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Open access panel 223LZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 CONFIG-1 26-15-01 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Visually Check Baggage Compartment Smoke Detection System Maintenance LED (Figure 601) SUBTASK 212-005-B (1) Make sure that the BAGG SMOKE warning message is out of view on the EICAS display. (2) On the maintenance panel, set the BAGG SMK DET switch to position 1. (3) Make sure that the maintenance LED comes on on the cargo smoke detector 1. (4) Release the BAGG SMK DET switch. (5) Visually check the maintenance LED at the cargo smoke detector 1 (Figure 601): (a) Make sure that the LED is off. (6) Make sure that the BAGG SMOKE warning message is out of view on the EICAS display. (7) On the maintenance panel, set the BAGG SMK DET switch to position 2. (8) Make sure that the maintenance LED comes on on the cargo smoke detector 2. (9) Release the BAGG SMK DET switch. (10) Visually check the maintenance LED at the cargo smoke detector 2 (Figure 601): (a) Make sure that the LED is off. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-005-B (1) Close access panel 223LZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (2) De-energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 CONFIG-1 26-15-01 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-15-01-200-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH CLASS-C BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT 3. CARGO SMOKE DETECTION - VISUAL INSPECTION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to check the maintenance LED of the cargo smoke detectors. (2) This task is applicable to two cargo smoke detectors. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit 270 Baggage Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Press the test switch Cockpit 1 Inspect the maintenance LED Baggage Compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-006-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Energize the aircraft with a DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-802-A/600 CONFIG-1 26-15-01 Page 5 of 7 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Visually Check Baggage Compartment Smoke Detection System Maintenance LED (Figure 602) SUBTASK 212-009-B (1) Make sure that the BAGG SMOKE warning message is out of view on the EICAS display. (2) On the overhead panel, press and hold the FIRE TEST switch. (3) Make sure that the maintenance LEDs come on on the two cargo smoke detectors. (4) Release the FIRE TEST switch. (5) Visually check the maintenance LEDs at the two cargo smoke detectors (Figure 602): (a) Make sure that the LEDs are off. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-006-A (1) De-energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-802-A/600 CONFIG-1 26-15-01 Page 6 of 7 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
